description:
Add a header to the details pane showing the task ID and title.

## Current Behavior

Details pane shows task description/content but no clear header identifying which task.

## Desired Behavior

Details pane has a header:

```
┌─ Details ─────────────────────────────────────┐
│ [abc123] Add user authentication              │
│ ──────────────────────────────────────────    │
│                                               │
│ Description:                                  │
│   Implement OAuth2 authentication flow...     │
│                                               │
│ Acceptance Criteria:                          │
│   1. User can log in with Google              │
│   2. Session persists across refreshes        │
└───────────────────────────────────────────────┘
```

## Implementation

### internal/tui/model.go

In details pane rendering, add header:

```go
func (m *Model) renderDetailsPane() string {
    var lines []string
    
    // Header with task ID and title
    if m.selectedTask != nil {
        header := fmt.Sprintf("[%s] %s", m.selectedTask.ID, m.selectedTask.Title)
        lines = append(lines, headerStyle.Render(header))
        lines = append(lines, dividerStyle.Render(strings.Repeat("─", width-2)))
        lines = append(lines, "")
    }
    
    // ... rest of details content ...
}
```

## Styling

- Task ID in distinct color (e.g., blue or cyan)
- Title in bold or highlight
- Divider line separating header from content
